title: Weaving
content: Practiced in Palestine from the earliest times. The loom in use was an upright frame, provided with a horizontal beam (
) from which a row of threads, called the warp (

) was hung. Each thread ran through a loop, by means of which it was moved backwards and forwards, while the shuttle, a wooden implement shaped like a boat, passed to and fro among the threads of the warp, winding off from itself, as it went, the thread called the woof (
), which was at right angles with the warp. In
the shuttle is the emblem of the swift flight of man’s life.
